results.title: Dressing dad
results.creator_credit: Sofya Gollan, Isabel Perez, AFTRS and Lynne Vincent McCarthy
results.brief_description:
If your dad wore a dress, would it make him less of a father, less of a man? A daughter’s journey to understand her father’s long-kept secret as a cross-dresser.
Cast: Alastair Barns (the dad), Lynne Vincent McCarthy as the daughter voice-over, and Leslie, Bianca, Kimberley, Steffie and Kim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sofya Gollan, Isabel Perez, AFTRS and Lynne Vincent McCarthy
results.description:

results.title: D-evolution
results.creator_credit: Steven McGregor, Joe Weatherstone, AFTRS and Nicholas Searle
results.brief_description:
When the Huntress Shar catches her prey, the gorgeous Khan, in a lush forest glade, she thinks she’s come to the end of her hunt. But it’s only the beginning…
Combining traditional and contemporary visual effects tools, D-evolution attempts to tell a story about technology and reality, using technology itself to shape the visuals of the film.
Cast: Kate Beahan, Aaron Pedersen, Alana De Roma, Anni Finsterer
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven McGregor, Joe Weatherstone, AFTRS and Nicholas Searle
results.description:

results.title: The Cup and the lip
results.creator_credit: Bruno de Villenoisy, Joanna Robinski and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A difficult child and a good mother. A loose tooth, a sign on a wall, an imaginary word, ecstasy, anger… A disturbing film about the ultimate taboo.
Cast: Gosia Dobrowolska, Julian Barta
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruno de Villenoisy, Joanna Robinski and AFTRS

results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Marzena Domaradzka, Sean Croyston, AFTRS and Jason Camenzuli
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marzena Domaradzka, Sean Croyston, AFTRS and Jason Camenzuli

results.title: The Creepy Crawley's
results.creator_credit: Beck Cole, Citt Williams and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The Creepy Crawleys, a documentary film, is set in an isolated Australian country town and tells the story of Monte Cristo, a mysterious old mansion and its owners, past and present.
Contains b&w archival stills.
results.description:

Contains b&w archival stills.

results.title: Cherish
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, AFTRS and Romaine Moreton
results.brief_description:
“What peace is there for us whose best love cannot return them even for a day? …..The last word was yours.” (Jeannette Winterson ‘Written on the Body’)
A poetic and tender story celebrating life, love and death.
Cast: John Adam, Russell Page

results.title: Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Parker, Jessica Cribb and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. They live in Willmot, an isolated community on the outskirts of Western Sydney. It’s a no-go zone, a suburban wasteland with huge powerlines overhead. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.
results.description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. They live in Willmot, an isolated community on the outskirts of Western Sydney. It’s a no-go zone, a suburban wasteland with huge powerlines overhead. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.

results.title: Bias
results.creator_credit: Catriona McKenzie, Steve Pasvolsky, AFTRS and Alice Addison
results.brief_description:
Two old men are playing for the champion’s rosette in lawn bowls when a snail interupts play and causes one codger to win and the other to lose. The battle takes on a greater moral dimension…Animation and live action.
Cast: Lisle Jones, John Keightley

results.title: Bad Habits
results.creator_credit: Jason Ramp, Justin Davies, AFTRS and Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent
results.brief_description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).

results.title: B.L.A.C.K.: an Aboriginal song of hip hop
results.creator_credit: Grant Saunders, Roslyn Baker and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
B.L.A.C.K. is a cipher scribed by independent and Indigenous Hip Hop artist, Wire MC. Through interviews and observation the song is visually and dialectically deconstructed to speak of contemporary issues around Aboriginal blackness, politics and culture.
The filmmaker, with his own roots in Hip Hop, aligns himself with Wire MC and through a rapped narrative adds another layer of complexity to notions of blackness by pulling apart his own identity.
This is a musical documentary that exposes an authentic and empowering B.L.A.C.K. voice existing underneath the hype of “bling-bling” hip hop. This is a film with rhythm, rhyme and reason.
results.title_for_label: B.L.A.C.K.: an Aboriginal song of hip hop
